alert.note: Alert for Bullock; Lee; Macon; Montgomery; Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 6:12AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Elmore, southwestern Lee, northern Bullock, Macon, south central Tallapoosa and northeastern Montgomery Counties through 645 AM CDT... At 612 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Tysonville, or near Milstead, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Montgomery, Auburn, Tuskegee, Wetumpka, Tallassee, Union Springs, Notasulga, Milstead, Eclectic, Shorter, Franklin, Santuck, Auburn University In Montgomery, Lake Tuskegee, Guerryton, Tuskegee National Forest, Waugh, Lagoon Park, Liverpool and Alabama State University. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
